snippet.textDisplay:
Un poquito de bencina
Para tu lindo coche,
Juanito el mecánico
Está pa' petar el turbo
Para que quedes el mejor. (¡El mejor!)

¡Ole, olé! ¡Ole, olé!
Cuatro ruedas al sol.
¡Ole, olé! ¡Ole, olé!
Cuatro ruedas al sol

Tres, dos, un, ¡VAMOS!

snippet.textDisplay:
well, the athmospere in the game is perfect. a large cool world, with many unknown creatures, mazing graphics (for the time it came out), and awesome music. it all fits together to perfection.
copple this with great gameplay, tight controls, innovative puzzles, (kind of) co-op action, humor and well designed characters with good voice actors.... well go figure

snippet.textDisplay: I liked Jade's design, perhaps that picture doesn't do the in-game character model justice. I liked her clothing and hair style, gives her an edge which fits nicely with the semi-futuristic world, and remember that the games graphical style isn't a ultra realstic one, it's stylized with slightly exaggerated features. If you want to know what a more realistic looking Jade would look like, try Alex Vance from Half-Life 2.
snippet.textOriginal: I liked Jade's design, perhaps that picture doesn't do the in-game character model justice. I liked her clothing and hair style, gives her an edge which fits nicely with the semi-futuristic world, and remember that the games graphical style isn't a ultra realstic one, it's stylized with slightly exaggerated features. If you want to know what a more realistic looking Jade would look like, try Alex Vance from Half-Life 2.

snippet.textDisplay:
well yes, you do have a point Wolf, but come on, you have to agree that Jade's character design could have been MUCH better.
And you're using extremes as an example. DOA and RR are examples where girls are portrayed as being perfect.... I'm not asking for that, just asking for an acceptable design...which Jade does NOT have.
snippet.textOriginal:
well yes, you do have a point Wolf, but come on, you have to agree that Jade's character design could have been MUCH better.
And you're using extremes as an example. DOA and RR are examples where girls are portrayed as being perfect.... I'm not asking for that, just asking for an acceptable design...which Jade does NOT have.

snippet.textDisplay:
Ah, and yes Supradarky, I think it was in that disc minigame you could play at the mini bar. 

And CovertLoneWolf: I loved Beyond Good  & Evil and Jade was a great main character, but I have to admit, I also like Rumble Roses and Dead or Alive ;D. Btw, I think in last year's EA a teaser trailer about BG&E2 was shown.
snippet.textOriginal:
Ah, and yes Supradarky, I think it was in that disc minigame you could play at the mini bar.

snippet.textDisplay: Sigma I'm hoping that was a joke, if it isn't thats a terrible attitude to have and you're they reason we have trash like Dead or Alive Xtreme Beach Volleyball and Rumble Roses. I hate seeing these women in games with impossible bodies and perfect skin as it just plays to the stereotype that gaming is only for teenage boys. I see gaming as an artform and a new medium of storytelling that whilst its still in its infancy, has real potential. We need more female leads like Jade and less T&A.
snippet.textOriginal: Sigma I'm hoping that was a joke, if it isn't thats a terrible attitude to have and you're they reason we have trash like Dead or Alive Xtreme Beach Volleyball and Rumble Roses. I hate seeing these women in games with impossible bodies and perfect skin as it just plays to the stereotype that gaming is only for teenage boys. I see gaming as an artform and a new medium of storytelling that whilst its still in its infancy, has real potential. We need more female leads like Jade and less T&A.
